episodeTitle: Epic Showdown! Swordsman Zoro vs. Acrobat Cabaji!
episodeTitleJapanese: 壮絶決闘！剣豪ゾロVS曲芸のカバジ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Sōzetsu Kettō! Kengō Zoro tai Kyokugei no Kabaji!
description: Zoro battles Cabaji, Buggy's acrobatic Chief of Staff, in an intense one-on-one duel. Despite being injured, Zoro defeats Cabaji with his Oni Giri technique. Meanwhile, Nami steals a Grand Line map from Buggy's treasure. When Buggy damages Luffy's precious straw hat, Luffy becomes enraged, and the battle between the two captains intensifies.

events.title: Cabaji's Debut
events.description: Cabaji the Acrobat, Chief of Staff of the Buggy Pirates, makes his first appearance. He offers to battle the Straw Hats on Buggy's behalf after most of the Buggy Pirates crew members are taken out by the deflected Buggy Ball.
events.significance: Introduction of Buggy's second-in-command and a significant early opponent for Zoro. Establishes the hierarchy within the Buggy Pirates.

quotes.text: I am Cabaji the Acrobat, Chief of Staff of the Buggy Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Cabaji
quotes.context: Cabaji introduces himself as he challenges the Straw Hats

events.title: Oni Giri Debuts
events.description: Zoro uses his signature Three Sword Style technique, Oni Giri (Demon Slash), for the first time to defeat Cabaji. Despite being wounded from his previous battle with Buggy, Zoro crosses his three swords and slices through Cabaji with devastating force.
events.significance: First use of one of Zoro's most iconic and frequently used techniques. Demonstrates Zoro's immense strength and willpower even when injured, establishing him as a formidable swordsman.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro calls out his technique as he delivers the finishing blow to Cabaji

events.title: Zoro Defeats Cabaji
events.description: Cabaji, despite using dirty tactics throughout the fight and targeting Zoro's wound, is defeated by Zoro's Oni Giri technique. Cabaji falls from his unicycle, defeated, while Zoro collapses from exhaustion.
events.significance: Eliminates Buggy's Chief of Staff from the battle, leaving only Luffy and Buggy to fight. Proves Zoro's determination and skill.

quotes.speaker: Cabaji
quotes.context: Cabaji's reaction to losing despite his tactics

events.title: Nami Steals the Grand Line Map
events.description: While Zoro battles Cabaji, Nami sneaks away from the group and breaks into the pub where Buggy stored his treasure. She takes down a guard, opens a treasure chest with the stolen key, and discovers a map of the Grand Line inside, which she steals.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's thieving abilities and her interest in maps, particularly the Grand Line. Foreshadows her role as the crew's navigator and her dream to map the entire world.

quotes.text: A map of the Grand Line! This will fetch a nice price!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami discovers the valuable map in Buggy's treasure

events.title: Buggy's Grudge Against Shanks Revealed
events.description: After Luffy mentions being friends with Shanks, Buggy reacts with intense anger and hatred. He curses Shanks' name and reveals that he holds a deep, personal grudge against the Red-Haired pirate, though the details of their history are not yet explained.
events.significance: First revelation of a connection between Buggy and Shanks, suggesting they have shared history. This becomes an important plot point as it's later revealed they both served on Gol D. Roger's crew. Also deepens Buggy's character beyond just being a villain.

quotes.text: Shanks! Don't you dare speak that name!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy's furious reaction when Luffy mentions Shanks

events.title: Luffy's Rage Over His Damaged Straw Hat
events.description: Buggy damages Luffy's precious straw hat during their battle, stabbing it with three knives. Luffy becomes genuinely enraged for the first time, his usual carefree demeanor completely replaced with fury. He declares the hat to be his treasure.
events.significance: Reinforces the deep emotional significance of the straw hat to Luffy and his connection to Shanks. One of the few times Luffy shows genuine anger rather than just determination. The hat represents his promise to Shanks and his dream.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration after Buggy damages his straw hat

events.title: Luffy vs Buggy Intensifies
events.description: With Zoro having defeated Cabaji, the battle between Luffy and Buggy becomes the sole focus. The confrontation intensifies after Buggy damaged Luffy's straw hat, with Luffy now fighting with genuine anger.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic battle between the two captains that will determine Orange Town's fate.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Fusen Deflects Buggy Ball
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Fusen (Gum-Gum Balloon) for the first time, inflating his body to catch and deflect Buggy's cannonball back at the Buggy Pirates, decimating their forces.
events.significance: Introduces a new application of Luffy's Devil Fruit powers, showing his ability to use his rubber body defensively. This technique becomes important throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses his balloon technique to deflect the Buggy Ball

events.title: Zoro vs Cabaji Begins
events.description: Zoro accepts Cabaji's challenge and the two begin their one-on-one duel. Cabaji fights using his acrobatic Carnival Tricks style on his unicycle, while Zoro battles despite still being injured from his previous encounter with Buggy.
events.significance: The first proper swordsman-vs-swordsman duel in the series, showcasing different fighting styles.

events.title: Cabaji's Dirty Fighting Tactics
events.description: Throughout the duel, Cabaji repeatedly uses dishonorable tactics, including targeting Zoro's existing wound and using various circus weapons and tricks. This contrasts with Zoro's more straightforward, honorable fighting style.
events.significance: Establishes the difference between honorable and dishonorable fighters in the One Piece world. Shows Zoro's code of honor even when his opponent has none.

quotes.text: There's no such thing as dirty fighting in a real battle!
quotes.speaker: Cabaji
Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's emotional declaration after Buggy damages his straw hat

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's signature technique debut as he defeats Cabaji

quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy reveals his hatred of Shanks

quotes.speaker: Cabaji

themes.description: Zoro's battle with Cabaji showcases the contrast between honorable and dishonorable fighting. Despite Cabaji's dirty tactics and Zoro's injuries, Zoro's determination and skill prevail.
themes.symbolism: Zoro fighting through his wounds represents the willpower and determination central to the series.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes what different characters treasure most. For Luffy, it's his straw hat representing his promise to Shanks. For Nami, it's valuable maps. For Buggy, it's literal treasure.
themes.symbolism: The straw hat symbolizes dreams, promises, and emotional connections that transcend material value.

themes.description: Buggy's grudge against Shanks hints at complex histories between characters, suggesting that the pirate world is interconnected in ways not yet revealed.
themes.symbolism: The revelation of Buggy's hatred for Shanks foreshadows the deeper connections in the pirate world.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his strength, skill, and determination by defeating Cabaji despite being wounded. His debut of Oni Giri establishes him as a formidable swordsman with signature techniques.

Endures Cabaji's dirty tactics and attacks on his wound
Uses Oni Giri for the first time to defeat Cabaji

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows genuine anger for one of the first times when his straw hat is damaged, revealing the deep emotional significance of the hat and his connection to Shanks.
keyActions: Deflects Buggy Ball using Gomu Gomu no Fusen

Declares the hat to be his treasure

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as Buggy's Chief of Staff and skilled acrobatic fighter. His use of dirty tactics contrasts with Zoro's honorable fighting style, but he is ultimately defeated.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the Zoro vs Cabaji fight with additional sequences and attacks not present in the manga, adding more detail to Cabaji's acrobatic techniques.
Some of Cabaji's circus tricks and weapon uses are shown in more detail in the anime compared to the manga's briefer depiction.

trivia.fact: Oni Giri, which debuts in this episode, becomes one of Zoro's most frequently used techniques throughout the entire series.

sources.title: Three Sword Style - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Cabaji's voice actor in Japanese, Endō Moriya, also voiced several other minor characters throughout the One Piece series.
This episode adapts content from manga chapters 15-18, covering Zoro's battle with Cabaji and the continuation of Luffy's fight with Buggy.
The revelation of Buggy's grudge against Shanks in this episode plants the seeds for one of the series' long-running subplot about their shared history on the Roger Pirates.
This is the first episode where Luffy shows genuine rage rather than just determination or annoyance, demonstrating how precious the straw hat is to him.
